lead_paragraph: BARAS--Robert. Robert "Bob" Baras, 85, passed away peacefully at his home in Westport, CT on February 7, 2016 surrounded by his family, friends and his loving caregivers. Robert was born in Brooklyn, NY to Esther (Hertan) and Solomon Baras. Both were Romanian immigrants. He was raised in the Bronx and graduated from DeWitt Clinton High School, and then attended City College. Robert was a longtime resident of Manhattan, and Tourettes-sur-Loup, France. Bob was happily married to his wife of 49 years, Francine Baras. After building a large textile company, Inwood Knitting Mills, which he sold to National Distillers in 1969, Bob was able to realize his lifelong dream, his true passion for painting. He attended School of Visual Arts and received a BFA with honors. Bob spent the next 40 years painting and living his dream. His last show was at The White Gallery in Lakeville, Connecticut in May of 2015. Bob was also a photographer and left a large body of work. Robert is survived by his beloved wife, Francine Baras, daughters Lise Baras and Nicole Baras Feuer, and his son Lloyd Baras. Bob adored his three grandchildren, Adam Feuer, Eric Feuer, and Jonathon Baras. He was predeceased by his daughter, Ilene Marback. Bob also lost his brother Irwin Baras in World War II. Funeral services will take place on Thursday, February 11, 2016 at 11:00am at the Abraham L. Green and Son Funeral Home, 88 Beach Road, Fairfield, CT. Memorial contributions may be made to The Alzheimer's Association. 1/3
